BiblioData.Title: INTERFACE CONDITIONING TO IMPROVE EFFICIENCY AND LIFETIME OF ORGANIC ELECTROLUMINESCENCE DEVICES
BiblioData.Abstract: In at least one embodiment of the invention, an OLED device is disclosed in which the surface of one or more layers of the OLED are conditioned with metal nano-particles such that they are disposed along the interface between adjacent layers.

Claims.P: 1. An electroluminescent device, comprising:
an anode layer;
a cathode layer; and

an stack of layers between said anode layer and said cathode layer, said stack of layers including at least one layer comprising organic material, wherein at least one nano-particle is disposed in at least one interface between layers in said stack of layers or between said stack of layers and said cathode layer.
2. The device according to claim 1 wherein said stack of layers includes at least one of:
an anode buffer layer disposed over said anode layer;
an emissive layer, said emissive layer capable of emitting light; and
a hole transporting interlayer.
3. The device according to claim 2 further wherein any of said layers in said stack of layers may also comprise a light emissive component.
4. The device according to claim 1 wherein any layers within said stack of layers are formed at least in part using at least one polymer organic material.
5. The device according to claim 1 wherein any layers within said stack of layers are formed at least in part using at least one small molecule material.
6. The device according to claim 2 wherein said emissive layer comprises a conjugated poly-p-phenylenevinylene polymer.
7. The device according to claim 2 wherein said emissive layer comprises a conjugated polyspiro polymer.
8. The device according to claim 2 wherein said emissive layer comprises a conjugated fluorene polymer.
9. The device according to claim 1 wherein said at least one nano-particle comprises at least one of Ag, Au, Ni, Fe, Co, Ge, Cu, Pt, Pd, Os, Ti, Si or compounds thereof.
10. The device according to claim 3 wherein said light emissive component comprises at least one phosphorescence-based emitter.
11. The device according to claim 3 wherein said light emissive component comprises at least one fluorescence-based emitter.
12. The device according to claim 3 wherein said light emissive component comprises at least one based-based emitter and at least one fluorescence-based emitter.
13. The device according to claim 1 wherein said at least one nano-particle is disposed by at least one of sputtering, spin coating, spray coating, or thermal evaporation.
14. The device according to claim 1 wherein said at least one nano-particle forms into an ultra-thin layer of nano-particles upon being disposed.
15. The device according to claim 1 wherein each of said at least one nano-particle has a size ranging from 0.01 to 10 nano-meters.
16. The device according to claim 1 wherein said at least one nano-particle comprises a core of a first material and a shell of a second different material.
17. The device according to claim 16 wherein said first material is silica.
18. The device according to claim 17 wherein said second material comprises at least one of Ag, Au, Ni, Fe, Co, Ge, Cu, Pt, Pd, Os, Ti, Si or compounds thereof.

19. The device of claim 1 wherein said at least one nano-particle has an absorption spectrum which overlaps the triplet exciton state of the material in either one of the layers defining the interface wherein said at least one nano-particle is disposed.

20. The device of claim 19 wherein said at least one nano-particle has a resonance with the triplet exciton state of the material in either one of the layers defining the interface wherein said at least one nano-particle is disposed.
